apiKey.name: Authorization
apiKey.description: API key needed to access this API

bearerToken.description: API key needed to access this API, in Bearer token format

addonCreateUpdateSchema.description: Data required to create or update an [Unleash addon](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/addons) instance.

provider.description:
The addon provider, such as "webhook" or "slack". This string is **case sensitive** and maps to the provider's `name` property.

The list of all supported providers and their parameters for a specific Unleash instance can be found by making a GET request to the `api/admin/addons` endpoint: the `providers` property of that response will contain all available providers.

The default set of providers can be found in the [addons reference documentation](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/addons). The default supported options are:
- `datadog` for [Datadog](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/addons/datadog)
- `slack` for [Slack](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/addons/slack)
- `teams` for [Microsoft Teams](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/addons/teams)
- `webhook` for [webhooks](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/addons/webhook)

The provider you choose for your addon dictates what properties the `parameters` object needs. Refer to the documentation for each provider for more information.

description.description: A description of the addon.
description.example: This addon posts updates to our internal feature tracking system whenever a feature is created or updated.

enabled.description: Whether the addon should be enabled or not.

parameters.description: Parameters for the addon provider. This object has different required and optional properties depending on the provider you choose. Consult the documentation for details.

events.description: The event types that will trigger this specific addon.

projects.description: The projects that this addon will listen to events from. An empty list means it will listen to events from **all** projects.

environments.description: The list of environments that this addon will listen to events from. An empty list means it will listen to events from **all** environments.

name.description: The name of the parameter as it is used in code. References to this parameter should use this value.

displayName.description: The name of the parameter as it is shown to the end user in the Admin UI.

type.description: The type of the parameter. Corresponds roughly to [HTML `input` field types](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Element/Input#input_types). Multi-line inut fields are indicated as `textfield` (equivalent to the HTML `textarea` tag).

description.example: The emoji_icon to use when posting messages to slack. Defaults to ":unleash:".
description.description: A description of the parameter. This should explain to the end user what the parameter is used for.

placeholder.description: The default value for this parameter. This value is used if no other value is provided.

required.description: Whether this parameter is required or not. If a parameter is required, you must give it a value when you create the addon. If it is not required it can be left out. It may receive a default value in those cases.

sensitive.description: Indicates whether this parameter is **sensitive** or not. Unleash will not return sensitive parameters to API requests. It will instead use a number of asterisks to indicate that a value is set, e.g. "******". The number of asterisks does not correlate to the parameter's value.

addonSchema.description: An [addon](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/addons) instance description. Contains data about what kind of provider it uses, whether it's enabled or not, what events it listens for, and more.

id.description: The addon's unique identifier.

provider.description: The addon provider, such as "webhook" or "slack".

description.description: A description of the addon. `null` if no description exists.
description.example: This addon posts updates to our internal feature tracking system whenever a feature is created or updated.

enabled.description: Whether the addon is enabled or not.

parameters.description: Parameters for the addon provider. This object has different required and optional properties depending on the provider you choose.

events.description: The event types that trigger this specific addon.

projects.description: The projects that this addon listens to events from. An empty list means it listens to events from **all** projects.

environments.description: The list of environments that this addon listens to events from. An empty list means it listens to events from **all** environments.

addonTypeSchema.description: An addon provider. Defines a specific addon type and what the end user must configure when creating a new addon of that type.

name.description: The name of the addon type. When creating new addons, this goes in the payload's `type` field.

displayName.description: The addon type's name as it should be displayed in the admin UI.

documentationUrl.description: A URL to where you can find more information about using this addon type.

description.description: A description of the addon type.
description.example: Allows Unleash to post updates to Slack.

howTo.description: A long description of how to use this addon type. This will be displayed on the top of configuration page. Can contain markdown.
howTo.example:
This is **how you use** this addon type...
  - Step 1
  - Step 2
  - Step 3

tagTypes.description: A list of [Unleash tag types](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/tags#tag-types) that this addon uses. These tags will be added to the Unleash instance when an addon of this type is created.

example.name: slack
example.description: Slack tag used by the slack-addon to specify the slack channel.

parameters.description: The addon provider's parameters. Use these to configure an addon of this provider type. Items with `required: true` must be provided.

example.name: url
example.description: (Required)

example.name: username
example.description: The username to use when posting messages to slack. Defaults to "Unleash".

example.name: emojiIcon
example.description: The emoji_icon to use when posting messages to slack. Defaults to ":unleash:".

example.name: defaultChannel
example.description: (Required) Default channel to post updates to if not specified in the slack-tag

events.description: All the [event types](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api/legacy/unleash/admin/events#feature-toggle-events) that are available for this addon provider.

installation.description: The installation configuration for this addon type.

url.description: A URL to where the addon configuration should redirect to install addons of this type.

title.description: The title of the installation configuration. This will be displayed to the user when installing addons of this type.

helpText.description: The help text of the installation configuration. This will be displayed to the user when installing addons of this type.
helpText.example: Clicking the Install button will send you to Slack to initiate the installation procedure for the Unleash Slack app for your workspace

alerts.description: A list of alerts to display to the user when installing addons of this type.

type.description: The type of alert. This determines the color of the alert.

text.description: The text of the alert. This is what will be displayed to the user.
text.example: Please ensure you have the Unleash Slack App installed in your Slack workspace if you haven't installed it already. If you want the Unleash Slack App bot to post messages to private channels, you'll need to invite it to those channels.

deprecated.description: This should be used to inform the user that this addon type is deprecated and should not be used. Deprecated addons will show a badge with this information on the UI.
deprecated.example: This integration is deprecated. Please try the new integration instead.

addonsSchema.description:
An object containing two things:
1. A list of all [addons](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/addons) defined on this Unleash instance
2. A list of all addon providers defined on this instance

addons.description: All the addons that exist on this instance of Unleash.

providers.description: A list of  all available addon providers, along with their parameters and descriptions.

example.name: webhook
example.description: A Webhook is a generic way to post messages from Unleash to third party services.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: (Required) Unleash will perform a HTTP Post to the specified URL (one retry if first attempt fails)

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: (Optional) The Content-Type header to use. Defaults to "application/json".

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: (Optional) The Authorization header to use. Not used if left blank.

parameters.name: bodyTemplate
parameters.description: (Optional) You may format the body using a mustache template. If you don't specify anything, the format will similar to the events format (https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api/legacy/unleash/admin/events)

example.name: slack
example.description: Allows Unleash to post updates to Slack.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: (Required)

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username to use when posting messages to slack. Defaults to "Unleash".

parameters.name: emojiIcon
parameters.description: The emoji_icon to use when posting messages to slack. Defaults to ":unleash:".

parameters.name: defaultChannel
parameters.description: (Required) Default channel to post updates to if not specified in the slack-tag

tagTypes.name: slack
tagTypes.description: Slack tag used by the slack-addon to specify the slack channel.

example.name: teams
example.description: Allows Unleash to post updates to Microsoft Teams.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: (Required)

example.name: datadog
example.description: Allows Unleash to post updates to Datadog.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Default URL: https://api.datadoghq.com/api/v1/events. Needs to be changed if your're not using the US1 site.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description: (Required) API key to connect to Datadog

tagTypes.name: datadog
tagTypes.description: All Datadog tags added to a specific feature are sent to datadog event stream.

adminCountSchema.description: Contains total admin counts for an Unleash instance.

password.description: Total number of admins that have a password set.

noPassword.description: Total number of admins that do not have a password set. May be SSO, but may also be users that did not set a password yet.

service.description: Total number of service accounts that have the admin root role.

adminFeaturesQuerySchema.description: Query parameters used to modify the list of features returned.

tag.description: Used to filter by tags. For each entry, a TAGTYPE:TAGVALUE is expected

namePrefix.description: A case-insensitive prefix filter for the names of feature flags

id.description: The ID of this segment

name.description: The name of this segment

description.description: The description for this segment
description.example: IOS users segment

constraints.description: The list of constraints that are used in this segment

usedInFeatures.description: The number of feature flags that use this segment. The number also includes the any flags with pending change requests that would add this segment.

usedInProjects.description: The number of projects that use this segment. The number includes any projects with pending change requests that would add this segment.

project.description: The project the segment belongs to. Only present if the segment is a project-specific segment.

createdAt.description: When the segment was created

advancedPlaygroundEnvironmentFeatureSche.description: A simplified feature flag model intended for the Unleash playground.

name.description: The feature's name.

environment.description: The feature's environment.

context.description: The context to use when evaluating flags

projectId.description: The ID of the project that contains this feature.

strategies.description: Feature's applicable strategies and cumulative results of the strategies

result.description:
The cumulative results of all the feature's strategies. Can be `true`,
                                  `false`, or `unknown`.
                                  This property will only be `unknown`
                                  if one or more of the strategies can't be fully evaluated and the rest of the strategies
                                  all resolve to `false`.

data.description: The strategies that apply to this feature.

isEnabledInCurrentEnvironment.description: Whether the feature is active and would be evaluated in the provided environment in a normal SDK context.

isEnabled.description:
Whether this feature is enabled or not in the current environment.
                          If a feature can't be fully evaluated (that is, `strategies.result` is `unknown`),
                          this will be `false` to align with how client SDKs treat unresolved feature states.

variant.description:
The feature variant you receive based on the provided context or the _disabled
                          variant_. If a feature is disabled or doesn't have any
                          variants, you would get the _disabled variant_.
                          Otherwise, you'll get one of the feature's defined variants.

name.description: The variant's name. If there is no variant or if the flag is disabled, this will be `disabled`

enabled.description: Whether the variant is enabled or not. If the feature is disabled or if it doesn't have variants, this property will be `false`

payload.description: An optional payload attached to the variant.

type.description: The format of the payload.

feature_enabled.description: Whether the feature is enabled or not. If the feature is disabled, this property will be `false`

advancedPlaygroundFeatureSchema.description: A simplified feature flag model intended for the Unleash playground.

name.description: The feature's name.

projectId.description: The ID of the project that contains this feature.

environments.description: The lists of features that have been evaluated grouped by environment.

advancedPlaygroundRequestSchema.description: Data for the playground API to evaluate toggles in advanced mode with environment and context multi selection

environments.description: The environments to evaluate toggles in.

projects.description: A list of projects to check for toggles in.

oneOf.description: A list of projects to check for toggles in.
Check toggles in all projects.

advancedPlaygroundResponseSchema.description: The state of all features given the provided input.

input.description: The given input used to evaluate the features.

features.description: The list of features that have been evaluated.

invalidContextProperties.description: A list of top-level context properties that were provided as input that are not valid due to being the wrong type.

username.description: This property was deprecated in Unleash v5. Prefer the `tokenName` property instead.

tokenName.description: A unique name for this particular token

type.description: The type of API token

environment.description: The environment the token has access to. `*` if it has access to all environments.

project.description: The project this token belongs to.

projects.description: The list of projects this token has access to. If the token has access to specific projects they will be listed here. If the token has access to all projects it will be represented as `[*]`

expiresAt.description: The token's expiration date. NULL if the token doesn't have an expiration set.

createdAt.description: When the token was created.

seenAt.description: When the token was last seen/used to authenticate with. NULL if the token has not yet been used for authentication.

alias.description: Alias is no longer in active use and will often be NULL. It's kept around as a way of allowing old proxy tokens created with the old metadata format to keep working.

tokens.description: A list of Unleash API tokens.

applicationEnvironmentInstancesSchema.description: Data about an application environment instances that are connected to Unleash via an SDK.

instanceId.description: A unique identifier identifying the instance of the application running the SDK. Often changes based on execution environment. For instance: two pods in Kubernetes will have two different instanceIds

sdkVersion.description: An SDK version identifier. Usually formatted as "unleash-client-<language>:<version>"

clientIp.description: An IP address identifying the instance of the application running the SDK

lastSeen.description: The last time the application environment instance was seen

applicationEnvironmentIssuesSchema.description: This list of issues that might be wrong with the application

missingFeatures.description: The list of features that are missing in Unleash

outdatedSdks.description: The list of used SDKs that are outdated

name.description: Name of the application environment

instanceCount.description: The number of instances of the application environment

sdks.description: SDKs used in the application environment

lastSeen.description: The last time the application environment was seen

issues.description: This list of issues that might be wrong with the application

applicationOverviewIssuesSchema.description: This list of issues that might be wrong with the application

missingStrategies.description: The list of strategies that are missing from Unleash

applicationOverviewSchema.description: Data about an application that's connected to Unleash via an SDK.

projects.description: The list of projects the application has been using.

featureCount.description: The number of features the application has been using.

environments.description: The list of environments the application has been using.

issues.description: This list of issues that might be wrong with the application

applicationSchema.description: Data about an application that's connected to Unleash via an SDK.

sdkVersion.description: Which SDK and version the application reporting uses. Typically represented as `<identifier>:<version>`

strategies.description: Which [strategies](https://docs.getunleash.io/topics/the-anatomy-of-unleash#activation-strategies) the application has loaded. Useful when trying to figure out if your [custom strategy](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/custom-activation-strategies) has been loaded in the SDK

description.description: Extra information added about the application reporting the metrics. Only present if added via the Unleash Admin interface
description.example: Application for reporting page visits

url.description: A link to reference the application reporting the metrics. Could for instance be a GitHub link to the repository of the application

color.description: The CSS color that is used to color the application's entry in the application list

icon.description: An URL to an icon file to be used for the applications's entry in the application list

usage.description: The list of projects the application has been using.

applicationUsageSchema.description: Data about an project that have been used by applications.

project.description: Name of the project

environments.description: Which environments have been accessed in this project.

applicationsSchema.description: An object containing a list of applications that have connected to Unleash via an SDK.

total.description: The total number of project applications.

applications.description: The list of applications that have connected to this Unleash instance.

batchFeaturesSchema.description: A list of feature flag names for batch operations

batchStaleSchema.description: A list of features to operate on and whether they should be marked as stale or as not stale.

features.description: A list of features to mark as (not) stale

stale.description: Whether the list of features should be marked as stale or not stale. If `true`, the features will be marked as stale. If `false`, the features will be marked as not stale.

bulkMetricsSchema.description: A batch of metrics accumulated by Edge (or other compatible applications). Includes both application registrations as well usage metrics from clients

applications.description: A list of applications registered by an Unleash SDK

metrics.description: a list of client usage metrics registered by downstream providers. (Typically Unleash Edge)

bulkRegistrationSchema.description: An application registration. Defines the format POSTed by our server-side SDKs when they're starting up

connectVia.description:
A list of applications this app registration has been registered through. If connected directly to Unleash, this is an empty list. 
 This can be used in later visualizations to tell how many levels of proxy or Edge instances our SDKs have connected through

appName.description: The name of the application that is evaluating toggles

environment.description: Which environment the application is running in

interval.description: How often (in seconds) the application refreshes its features

sdkVersion.description: The version the sdk is running. Typically <client>:<version>

bulkToggleFeaturesSchema.description: The feature list used for bulk toggle operations

features.description: The features that we want to bulk toggle

items.description: The feature name we want to toggle

changePasswordSchema.description: Change password as long as the token is a valid token

token.description: A reset token used to validate that the user is allowed to change the password.

password.description: The new password for the user

clientApplicationSchema.description: A client application is an instance of one of our SDKs

appName.description: An identifier for the app that uses the sdk, should be static across SDK restarts

instanceId.description: A unique identifier identifying the instance of the application running the SDK. Often changes based on execution environment. For instance: two pods in Kubernetes will have two different instanceIds

sdkVersion.description: An SDK version identifier. Usually formatted as "unleash-client-<language>:<version>"

environment.description: The SDK's configured 'environment' property. This property was deprecated in v5. This property  does **not** control which Unleash environment the SDK gets toggles for. To control Unleash environments, use the SDKs API key.

platformName.description: The platform the application is running on. For languages that compile to binaries, this can be omitted

platformVersion.description: The version of the platform the application is running on. Languages that compile to binaries, this is expected to be the compiler version used to assemble the binary.

yggdrasilVersion.description: The semantic version of the Yggdrasil engine used by the client. If the client is using a native engine this can be omitted.

specVersion.description: The version of the Unleash client specification the client supports

interval.description: How often (in seconds) does the client refresh its toggles

started.description: Either an RFC-3339 timestamp or a unix timestamp in seconds

strategies.description: Which strategies the SDKs runtime knows about

clientFeatureSchema.description: Feature flag configuration used by SDKs to evaluate state of a flag

name.description: The unique name of a feature flag. Is validated to be URL safe on creation

type.description: What kind of feature flag is this. Refer to the documentation on [feature flag types](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/feature-toggle-types) for more information

description.description: A description of the flag
description.example: No variants here

enabled.description: Whether the feature flag is enabled for the current API key or not. This is ANDed with the evaluation results of the strategies list, so if this is false, the evaluation result will always be false

stale.description: If this is true Unleash believes this feature flag has been active longer than Unleash expects a flag of this type to be active

impressionData.description: Set to true if SDKs should trigger [impression events](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/impression-data) when this flag is evaluated

project.description: Which project this feature flag belongs to

strategies.description: Evaluation strategies for this flag. Each entry in this list will be evaluated and ORed together

clientFeaturesQuerySchema.description: Query parameters active for a client features request

tag.description: Features tagged with one of these tags are included

project.description: Features that are part of these projects are included in this response. This is now handled by API tokens and was marked as deprecated in v5

namePrefix.description: Features are filtered to only include features whose name starts with this prefix

environment.description: Strategies for the feature flag configured for this environment are included. This is now handled by API tokens and was marked as deprecated in v5

inlineSegmentConstraints.description: Set to true if requesting client does not support Unleash-Client-Specification 4.2.2 or newer. Modern SDKs will have this set to false, since they will be able to merge constraints and segments themselves

clientFeaturesSchema.description: Configuration data for server-side SDKs for evaluating feature flags.

version.description: A version number for the format used in the response. Most Unleash instances now return version 2, which includes segments as a separate array

features.description: A list of feature flags with their configuration

segments.description: A list of [Segments](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/segments) configured for this Unleash instance

query.description: A summary of filters and parameters sent to the endpoint. Used by the server to build the features and segments response

clientMetricsEnvSchema.description: Used for reporting feature evaluation results from SDKs

featureName.description: Name of the feature checked by the SDK

appName.description: The name of the application the SDK is being used in

environment.description: Which environment the SDK is being used in

timestamp.description: The start of the time window these metrics are valid for. The window is 1 hour wide

yes.description: How many times the toggle evaluated to true

no.description: How many times the toggle evaluated to false

variants.description: How many times each variant was returned

clientMetricsSchema.description: Client usage metrics, accumulated in buckets of hour by hour by default

appName.description: The name of the application that is evaluating toggles

environment.description: Which environment the application is running in. This property was deprecated in v5. This can be determined by the API key calling this endpoint.

sdkVersion.description: An SDK version identifier. Usually formatted as "unleash-client-<language>:<version>"

platformName.description: The platform the application is running on. For languages that compile to binaries, this can be omitted

platformVersion.description: The version of the platform the application is running on. Languages that compile to binaries, this is expected to be the compiler version used to assemble the binary.

yggdrasilVersion.description: The semantic version of the Yggdrasil engine used by the client. If the client is using a native engine this can be omitted.

specVersion.description: The version of the Unleash client specification the client supports

bucket.description: Holds all metrics gathered over a window of time. Typically 1 hour wide

start.description: The start of the time window these metrics are valid for. The window is usually 1 hour wide

stop.description: The end of the time window these metrics are valid for. The window is 1 hour wide

toggles.description: an object containing feature names with yes/no plus variant usage

yes.description: How many times the toggle evaluated to true

no.description: How many times the toggle evaluated to false

variants.description: An object describing how many times each variant was returned. Variant names are used as properties, and the number of times they were exposed is the corresponding value (i.e. `{ [variantName]: number }`).

clientSegmentSchema.description: Represents a client API segment of users defined by a set of constraints.

id.description: The segment's id.

name.description: The name of the segment.

constraints.description: List of constraints that determine which users are part of the segment

cloneFeatureSchema.description: Copy of a feature with a new name

name.description: The name of the new feature

replaceGroupId.description: Whether to use the new feature name as its group ID or not. Group ID is used for calculating [stickiness](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/stickiness#calculation). Defaults to true.

constraintSchema.description: A strategy constraint. For more information, refer to [the strategy constraint reference documentation](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/strategy-constraints)

contextName.description: The name of the context field that this constraint should apply to.

operator.description: The operator to use when evaluating this constraint. For more information about the various operators, refer to [the strategy constraint operator documentation](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/strategy-constraints#strategy-constraint-operators).

caseInsensitive.description: Whether the operator should be case sensitive or not. Defaults to `false` (being case sensitive).

inverted.description: Whether the result should be negated or not. If `true`, will turn a `true` result into a `false` result and vice versa.

values.description: The context values that should be used for constraint evaluation. Use this property instead of `value` for properties that accept multiple values.

value.description: The context value that should be used for constraint evaluation. Use this property instead of `values` for properties that only accept single values.

name.description: The name of the context field

description.description: The description of the context field.
description.example: Used to uniquely identify users

stickiness.description: Does this context field support being used for [stickiness](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/stickiness) calculations

sortOrder.description: Used when sorting a list of context fields. Is also used as a tiebreaker if a list of context fields is sorted alphabetically.

createdAt.description: When this context field was created

usedInFeatures.description: Number of projects where this context field is used in

usedInProjects.description: Number of projects where this context field is used in

legalValues.description: Allowed values for this context field schema. Can be used to narrow down accepted input

contextFieldStrategiesSchema.description: A wrapper object containing all strategies that use a specific context field

strategies.description: List of strategies using the context field

id.description: The ID of the strategy.

featureName.description: The name of the feature that contains this strategy.

projectId.description: The ID of the project that contains this feature.

environment.description: The ID of the environment where this strategy is in.

createApiTokenSchema.description: The data required to create an [Unleash API token](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api-tokens-and-client-keys).

expiresAt.description: The time when this token should expire.

type.description: An admin token. Must be the string "admin" (not case sensitive).

expiresAt.description: The time when this token should expire.

type.description: An admin token. Must be the string "admin" (not case sensitive).

username.description: The name of the token. This property was deprecated in v5. Use `tokenName` instead.

expiresAt.description: The time when this token should expire.

type.description: A client or frontend token. Must be one of the strings "client" or "frontend" (not case sensitive).

environment.description: The environment that the token should be valid for. Defaults to "default"

project.description: The project that the token should be valid for. Defaults to "*" meaning every project. This property is mutually incompatible with the `projects` property. If you specify one, you cannot specify the other.

projects.description: A list of projects that the token should be valid for. This property is mutually incompatible with the `project` property. If you specify one, you cannot specify the other.

expiresAt.description: The time when this token should expire.

type.description: A client or frontend token. Must be one of the strings "client" or "frontend" (not case sensitive).

environment.description: The environment that the token should be valid for. Defaults to "default"

project.description: The project that the token should be valid for. Defaults to "*" meaning every project. This property is mutually incompatible with the `projects` property. If you specify one, you cannot specify the other.

projects.description: A list of projects that the token should be valid for. This property is mutually incompatible with the `project` property. If you specify one, you cannot specify the other.

username.description: The name of the token. This property was deprecated in v5. Use `tokenName` instead.

createApplicationSchema.description: Reported application information from Unleash SDKs

sdkVersion.description: Which SDK and version the application reporting uses. Typically represented as `<identifier>:<version>`

strategies.description: Which [strategies](https://docs.getunleash.io/topics/the-anatomy-of-unleash#activation-strategies) the application has loaded. Useful when trying to figure out if your [custom strategy](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/custom-activation-strategies) has been loaded in the SDK

url.description: A link to reference the application reporting the metrics. Could for instance be a GitHub link to the repository of the application

color.description: Css color to be used to color the application's entry in the application list

icon.description: An URL to an icon file to be used for the applications's entry in the application list

createContextFieldSchema.description: Data used to create a context field configuration.

description.description: A description of the context field
description.example: The user's subscription tier

stickiness.description: `true` if this field should be available for use with [custom stickiness](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/stickiness#custom-stickiness), otherwise `false`

sortOrder.description: How this context field should be sorted if no other sort order is selected

legalValues.description: A list of allowed values for this context field

name.description: The name of the context field.

createDependentFeatureSchema.description: Feature dependency on a parent feature in write model

feature.description: The name of the feature we depend on.

enabled.description: Whether the parent feature should be enabled. When `false` variants are ignored. `true` by default.

variants.description: The list of variants the parent feature should resolve to. Leave empty when you only want to check the `enabled` status.

pattern.description: A JavaScript regular expression pattern, without the start and end delimiters. Optional flags are not allowed.

example.description: An example of a feature name that matches the pattern. Must itself match the pattern supplied.

description.description: A description of the pattern in a human-readable format. Will be shown to users when they create a new feature flag.
description.example:
<project>.<featureName>.<ticket>

The flag name should contain the project name, the feature name, and the ticket number, each separated by a dot.

createFeatureSchema.description: Data used to create a new feature flag.

name.description: Unique feature name

type.description: The feature flag's [type](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/feature-toggle-types). One of experiment, kill-switch, release, operational, or permission

description.example: Controls disabling of the comments section in case of an incident
description.description: Detailed description of the feature

impressionData.description: `true` if the impression data collection is enabled for the feature, otherwise `false`.

tags.description: Tags to add to the feature.

createFeatureStrategySchema.description: Create a strategy configuration in a feature

name.description: The name of the strategy type

title.description: A descriptive title for the strategy

disabled.description: A toggle to disable the strategy. defaults to false. Disabled strategies are not evaluated or returned to the SDKs

sortOrder.description: The order of the strategy in the list

constraints.description: A list of the constraints attached to the strategy. See https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/strategy-constraints

parameters.description: An object containing the parameters for the strategy

segments.description: Ids of segments to use for this strategy

createGroupSchema.description: A detailed information about a user group

createInvitedUserSchema.description: Data used to create a user that has been invited to Unleash.

username.description: The user's username. Must be unique if provided.

createPatSchema.description: Describes the properties required to create a [personal access token](https://docs.getunleash.io/how-to/how-to-create-personal-access-tokens), or PAT. PATs are automatically scoped to the authenticated user.

description.description: The PAT's description.
description.example: user:xyzrandomstring

createStrategySchema.description: The data required to create a strategy type. Refer to the docs on [custom strategy types](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/custom-activation-strategies) for more information.

name.description: The name of the strategy type. Must be unique.

description.description: A description of the strategy type.
description.example: Enable the feature for users who have not logged in before.

editable.description: Whether the strategy type is editable or not. Defaults to `true`.

deprecated.description: Whether the strategy type is deprecated or not. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.description: The parameter list lets you pass arguments to your custom activation strategy. These will be made available to your custom strategy implementation.

name.description: The name of the parameter

type.description: The [type of the parameter](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/custom-activation-strategies#parameter-types)

description.description: A description of this strategy parameter. Use this to indicate to the users what the parameter does.
description.example: How many percent of users should see this feature?

required.description: Whether this parameter must be configured when using the strategy. Defaults to `false`

createStrategyVariantSchema.description: This is an experimental property. It may change or be removed as we work on it. Please don't depend on it yet. A strategy variant allows you to attach any data to strategies instead of only returning `true`/`false`. Strategy variants take precedence over feature variants.

name.description: The variant name. Must be unique for this feature flag

weight.description: The weight is the likelihood of any one user getting this variant. It is an integer between 0 and 1000. See the section on [variant weights](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/feature-toggle-variants#variant-weight) for more information

weightType.description: Set to `fix` if this variant must have exactly the weight allocated to it. If the type is `variable`, the weight will adjust so that the total weight of all variants adds up to 1000. Refer to the [variant weight documentation](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/feature-toggle-variants#variant-weight).

stickiness.description: The [stickiness](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/feature-toggle-variants#variant-stickiness) to use for distribution of this variant. Stickiness is how Unleash guarantees that the same user gets the same variant every time

payload.description: Extra data configured for this variant

type.description: The type of the value. Commonly used types are string, number, json and csv.

createTagSchema.description: Data used to create a new [tag](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/tags)

value.description: The value of the tag. The value must be between 2 and 50 characters long. Leading and trailing whitespace is ignored and will be trimmed before saving the tag value.

type.description: The [type](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/tags#tag-types) of the tag

email.description: The user's email address. Must be provided if username is not provided.

dateSchema.description: A representation of a date. Either as a date-time string or as a UNIX timestamp.

oneOf.description: An [RFC-3339](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3339.html)-compliant timestamp.
A [UNIX timestamp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time).

deprecatedSearchEventsSchema.description:
Search for events by type, project, feature, free-text query,
        or a combination thereof. Pass an empty object to fetch all events.

type.description: Find events by event type (case-sensitive).

project.description: Find events by project ID (case-sensitive).

feature.description: Find events by feature flag name (case-sensitive).

query.description: Find events by a free-text search query. The query will be matched against the event type, the username or email that created the event (if any), and the event data payload (if any).

limit.description: The maximum amount of events to return in the search result

offset.description: Which event id to start listing from

doraFeaturesSchema.description: The representation of a dora time to production feature metric

timeToProduction.description: The average number of days it takes a feature flag to get into production

edgeTokenSchema.description: A representation of a client token, limiting access to [CLIENT](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api-tokens-and-client-keys#client-tokens) (used by serverside SDKs) or [FRONTEND](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api-tokens-and-client-keys#front-end-tokens) (used by proxy SDKs)

projects.description: The list of projects this token has access to. If the token has access to specific projects they will be listed here. If the token has access to all projects it will be represented as [`*`]

type.description: The [API token](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api-tokens-and-client-keys#api-tokens)'s **type**. Unleash supports three different types of API tokens ([ADMIN](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api-tokens-and-client-keys#admin-tokens), [CLIENT](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api-tokens-and-client-keys#client-tokens), [FRONTEND](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api-tokens-and-client-keys#front-end-tokens)). They all have varying access, so when validating a token it's important to know what kind you're dealing with

token.description: The actual token value. [Unleash API tokens](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api-tokens-and-client-keys) are comprised of three parts. <project(s)>:<environment>.randomcharacters

sum.description: A SHA-256 checksum of the instance statistics to be used to verify that the data in this object has not been tampered with

integrationEventSchema.description: An object describing an integration event.

id.description: The integration event's ID. Integration event IDs are incrementing integers. In other words, a more recently created integration event will always have a higher ID than an older one. This ID is represented as a string since it is a BigInt.

integrationId.description: The ID of the integration that the integration event belongs to.

createdAt.description: The date and time of when the integration event was created. In other words, the date and time of when the integration handled the event.

state.description: The state of the integration event. Can be one of `success`, `failed` or `successWithErrors`.

stateDetails.description: Details about the state of the integration event.

event.description: The event that triggered this integration event.

details.description: Detailed information about the integration event. The contents vary depending on the type of integration and the specific details.

integrationEventsSchema.description: A response model with a list of integration events.

legalValueSchema.description: Describes a legal value. Typically used to limit possible values for contextFields or strategy properties

description.description: Describes this specific legal value
description.example: Deep fuchsia

username.description: The username trying to log in

password.description: The password of the user trying to log in

maintenanceSchema.description: The current state of Unleash's maintenance mode feature.

enabled.description: Whether maintenance mode is enabled or not.

permissions.description: User permissions for projects and environments

name.description: The name of the represented object.

outdatedSdksSchema.description: Data about outdated SDKs that should be upgraded.

sdkVersion.description: An outdated SDK version identifier. Usually formatted as "unleash-client-<language>:<version>"

applications.description: A list of applications using the SDK version

overrideSchema.description: An override for deciding which variant should be assigned to a user based on the context name

contextName.description: The name of the context field used to determine overrides

values.description: Which values that should be overriden

parametersSchema.description: A list of parameters for a strategy

parentFeatureOptionsSchema.description: A list of parent feature names available for a given child feature. Features that have their own parents are excluded.

parentVariantOptionsSchema.description: A list of parent variant names available for a given parent feature. This list includes strategy variants and feature environment variants.

passwordSchema.description: Fields used to create new password or update old password

password.description: The new password to change or validate.

oldPassword.description: The old password the user is changing. This field is for the non-admin users changing their own password.

confirmPassword.description: The confirmation of the new password. This field is for the non-admin users changing their own password.

patSchema.description: Describes a [personal access token](https://docs.getunleash.io/how-to/how-to-create-personal-access-tokens), or PAT. PATs are automatically scoped to the authenticated user.

id.description: The PAT's ID. PAT IDs are incrementing integers. In other words, a more recently created PAT will always have a higher ID than an older one.

secret.description: The token used for authentication. It is automatically generated by Unleash when the PAT is created and that is the only time this property is returned.

createdAt.description: The date and time of when the PAT was created.

seenAt.description: When the PAT was last seen/used to authenticate with. `null` if it has not been used yet.

userId.description: The ID of the user this PAT belongs to.

description.description: The PAT's description.
description.example: user:xyzrandomstring

path.description: The path to the property to operate on

op.description: The kind of operation to perform

from.description: The target to move or copy from, if performing one of those operations

value.description: The value to add or replace, if performing one of those operations

patsSchema.description: Contains a collection of [personal access tokens](https://docs.getunleash.io/how-to/how-to-create-personal-access-tokens), or PATs. PATs are automatically scoped to the authenticated user.

project.description: The project this permission applies to

environment.description: The environment this permission applies to

playgroundConstraintSchema.description: A strategy constraint. For more information, refer to [the strategy constraint reference documentation](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/strategy-constraints)

contextName.description: The name of the context field that this constraint should apply to.

operator.description: The operator to use when evaluating this constraint. For more information about the various operators, refer to [the strategy constraint operator documentation](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/strategy-constraints#strategy-constraint-operators).

caseInsensitive.description: Whether the operator should be case sensitive or not. Defaults to `false` (being case sensitive).

inverted.description: Whether the result should be negated or not. If `true`, will turn a `true` result into a `false` result and vice versa.

values.description: The context values that should be used for constraint evaluation. Use this property instead of `value` for properties that accept multiple values.

value.description: The context value that should be used for constraint evaluation. Use this property instead of `values` for properties that only accept single values.

result.description: Whether this was evaluated as true or false.

playgroundFeatureSchema.description: A simplified feature flag model intended for the Unleash playground.

name.description: The feature's name.

projectId.description: The ID of the project that contains this feature.

strategies.description: The feature's applicable strategies and cumulative results of the strategies

result.description:
The cumulative results of all the feature's strategies. Can be `true`,
                                  `false`, or `unknown`.
                                  This property will only be `unknown`
                                  if one or more of the strategies can't be fully evaluated and the rest of the strategies
                                  all resolve to `false`.

data.description: The strategies that apply to this feature.

hasUnsatisfiedDependency.description: Whether the feature has a parent dependency that is not satisfied

isEnabledInCurrentEnvironment.description: Whether the feature is active and would be evaluated in the provided environment in a normal SDK context.

isEnabled.description:
Whether this feature is enabled or not in the current environment.
                          If a feature can't be fully evaluated (that is, `strategies.result` is `unknown`),
                          this will be `false` to align with how client SDKs treat unresolved feature states.

variant.description:
The feature variant you receive based on the provided context or the _disabled
                          variant_. If a feature is disabled or doesn't have any
                          variants, you would get the _disabled variant_.
                          Otherwise, you'll get one of thefeature's defined variants.

name.description: The variant's name. If there is no variant or if the flag is disabled, this will be `disabled`

enabled.description: Whether the variant is enabled or not. If the feature is disabled or if it doesn't have variants, this property will be `false`

payload.description: An optional payload attached to the variant.

type.description: The format of the payload.

featureEnabled.description: Whether the feature is enabled or not.

playgroundRequestSchema.description: Data for the playground API to evaluate toggles

environment.description: The environment to evaluate toggles in.

projects.description: A list of projects to check for toggles in.

oneOf.description: A list of projects to check for toggles in.
Check toggles in all projects.

playgroundResponseSchema.description: The state of all features given the provided input.

input.description: The given input used to evaluate the features.

features.description: The list of features that have been evaluated.

playgroundSegmentSchema.description: The evaluated result of a segment as used by the Playground.

id.description: The segment's id.

name.description: The name of the segment.

result.description: Whether this was evaluated as true or false.

constraints.description: The list of constraints in this segment.

playgroundStrategySchema.description: An evaluated feature flag strategy as used by the Playground

name.description: The strategy's name.

id.description: The strategy's id.

result.description: The strategy's evaluation result. If the strategy is a custom strategy that Unleash can't evaluate, `evaluationStatus` will be `unknown`. Otherwise, it will be `true` or `false`

evaluationStatus.description: Signals that this strategy could not be evaluated. This is most likely because you're using a custom strategy that Unleash doesn't know about. The `unevaluated` result is also returned if the strategy is disabled.

enabled.description: Whether this strategy resolves to `false` or if it might resolve to `true`. Because Unleash can't evaluate the strategy, it can't say for certain whether it will be `true`, but if you have failing constraints or segments, it _can_ determine that your strategy would be `false`.

evaluationStatus.description: Signals that this strategy was evaluated successfully.

enabled.description: Whether this strategy evaluates to true or not.

variant.description:
The feature variant you receive based on the provided context or the _disabled
                          variant_. If a feature is disabled or doesn't have any
                          variants, you would get the _disabled variant_.
                          Otherwise, you'll get one of the feature's defined variants.

name.description: The variant's name. If there is no variant or if the toggle is disabled, this will be `disabled`

enabled.description: Whether the variant is enabled or not. If the feature is disabled or if it doesn't have variants, this property will be `false`

payload.description: An optional payload attached to the variant.

type.description: The format of the payload.

disabled.description: The strategy's status. Disabled strategies are not evaluated

segments.description: The strategy's segments and their evaluation results.

constraints.description: The strategy's constraints and their evaluation results.

parameters.description: The strategy's constraints and their evaluation results.

links.description: A set of links to actions you can perform on this strategy

projects.description: Which projects this user is a member of

name.description: Name of the application that is using the SDK. This is the same as the appName in the SDK configuration.

environments.description: The environments that the application is using. This is the same as the environment in the SDK configuration.

instances.description: The instances of the application that are using the SDK.

sdks.description: The SDKs that the application is using.

versions.description: The versions of the SDK that the application is using.

total.description: The total number of project applications.

applications.description: All applications defined for a specific project.

projectAverage.description: The average time it takes a feature flag to be enabled in production. The measurement unit is days.

features.description: An array of objects containing feature flag name and timeToProduction values. The measurement unit of timeToProduction is days.

owners.description: The users and/or groups that have the "owner" role in this project. If no such users or groups exist, the list will contain the "system" owner instead.

projectStatsSchema.description:
Statistics for a project, including the average time to production, number of features created, the project activity and more.

Stats are divided into current and previous **windows**.
- The **current window** is the past 30 days.
- The **previous window** is the 30 days **before** the current window (from 60 to 30 days ago)

avgTimeToProdCurrentWindow.description: The average time from when a feature was created to when it was enabled in the "production" environment during the current window

createdCurrentWindow.description: The number of feature flags created during the current window

createdPastWindow.description: The number of feature flags created during the previous window

archivedCurrentWindow.description: The number of feature flags that were archived during the current window

archivedPastWindow.description: The number of feature flags that were archived during the previous window

projectActivityCurrentWindow.description: The number of project events that occurred during the current window

projectActivityPastWindow.description: The number of project events that occurred during the previous window

projectMembersAddedCurrentWindow.description: The number of members that were added to the project during the current window

projectsSchema.description: An overview of all the projects in the Unleash instance

projects.description: A list of projects in the Unleash instance

name.description: The token's name.

secret.description: The actual value of the token. This is the part that is used by Unleash to create an invite link

url.description: The public signup link for the token. Users who follow this link will be taken to a signup page where they can create an Unleash user.

name.description: The token's name. Only for displaying in the UI

enabled.description: Whether the token is active. This property will always be `false` for a token that has expired.

expiresAt.description: The time when the token will expire.

createdAt.description: When the token was created.

users.description: Array of users that have signed up using the token.

role.description: Users who sign up using this token will be given this role.

publicSignupTokenUpdateSchema.description: Used by Unleash for updating a token's expiration date or, when deleting the invite link, it's status

enabled.description: Whether the token is active or not.

publicSignupTokensSchema.description: A wrapper object containing all the public signup tokens

tokens.description: An array of all the public signup tokens

variants.description: The variants to write to the provided environments

environments.description: The enviromnents to write the provided variants to

recordUiErrorSchema.description: An object representing an error from the UI

errorStack.description: The stack trace of the error

status.description: Whether the query against prometheus succeeded or failed

result.description: An array of values per metric. Each one represents a line in the graph labeled by its metric name

items.description: A representation of a single metric to build a line in a graph

metric.description: A key value set representing the metric

appName.description: Name of the application this metric relates to

values.description: An array of arrays. Each element of the array is an array of size 2 consisting of the 2 axis for the graph: in position zero the x axis represented as a number and position one the y axis represented as string

items.description: Either the x axis represented as a number or the y axis represented as a string

anyOf.description: An identifier for the line in the graph
The number of requests at this point in time

segmentValues.description: The maximum number of values per segment allowed.

environments.description: The maximum number of environments allowed.

apiTokens.description: The maximum number of SDK and admin API tokens you can have at the same time. This limit applies only to server-side and client-side SDK tokens and to admin tokens. Personal access tokens are not subject to this limit. The limit applies to the total number of tokens across all projects in your organization.

projects.description: The maximum number of projects allowed.

segments.description: The maximum number of segments allowed.

featureFlags.description: The maximum number of feature flags you can have at the same time. Archived flags do not count towards this limit.

roleSchema.description: A role holds permissions to allow Unleash to decide what actions a role holder is allowed to perform

id.description: The role id

type.description: A role can either be a global root role (applies to all projects) or a project role

name.description: The name of the role

description.description: A more detailed description of the role and what use it's intended for
description.example: Users with the editor role have access to most features in Unleash but can not manage users and roles in the global scope. Editors will be added as project owners when creating projects and get superuser rights within the context of these projects. Users with the editor role will also get access to most permissions on the default project by default.

project.description: What project the role belongs to

description.example: Gradual rollout to logged in users

editable.description: Whether the strategy can be edited or not. Strategies bundled with Unleash cannot be edited.

strategyVariantSchema.description: This is an experimental property. It may change or be removed as we work on it. Please don't depend on it yet. A strategy variant allows you to attach any data to strategies instead of only returning `true`/`false`. Strategy variants take precedence over feature variants.

name.description: The variant name. Must be unique for this feature flag

weight.description: The weight is the likelihood of any one user getting this variant. It is an integer between 0 and 1000. See the section on [variant weights](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/feature-toggle-variants#variant-weight) for more information

weightType.description: Set to `fix` if this variant must have exactly the weight allocated to it. If the type is `variable`, the weight will adjust so that the total weight of all variants adds up to 1000. Refer to the [variant weight documentation](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/feature-toggle-variants#variant-weight).

type.description:
The [type of environment](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/environments#environment-types) you would like to create. Unleash officially recognizes the following values:
- `development`
- `test`
- `preproduction`
- `production`

If you pass a string that is not one of the recognized values, Unleash will accept it, but it will carry no special semantics.

enabled.description: Newly created environments are enabled by default. Set this property to `false` to create the environment in a disabled state.

defaultStickiness.description: A default stickiness for the project affecting the default stickiness value for variants and Gradual Rollout strategy

environments.description: A list of environments that should be enabled for this project. When provided, the list must contain at least one environment. If this property is missing, Unleash will default to enabling all non-deprecated environments for the project.

changeRequestEnvironments.description: A list of environments that should have change requests enabled. If the list includes environments not in the `environments` list, they will still have change requests enabled.

requiredApprovals.description: The number of approvals required for a change request to be fully approved and ready to applied in this environment. If no value is provided, it will be set to the default number, which is 1. Values will be clamped to between 1 and 10 inclusive.

changeRequestDefaultChangeSchema.description:
A description of a default change that will be applied with the change request to prevent invalid states.

Default changes are changes that are applied in addition to explicit user-specified changes when a change request is applied. Any default changes are applied in the background and are not a real part of the change request.

payload.description: The necessary data to perform this change.

createBannerSchema.description: Describes the properties required to create or update a banner.

message.description: The message to display to all users. Supports markdown.
message.example: **Reminder to everyone**: Maintenance is scheduled for *2337-12-27*.

enabled.description: Whether the banner should be displayed currently. If not specified, defaults to true.

variant.description: The variant of the banner. One of "info", "warning", "error", or "success". If not specified, defaults to "info".

sticky.description: Whether the banner should be sticky on the screen. If not specified, defaults to `false`.

icon.description: The icon to display on the banner. Can be one of https://fonts.google.com/icons. If not specified, this will be the default icon for the variant. If "none", no icon will be displayed.

link.description: The link to display on the banner. Can either be an absolute or a relative link (e.g. absolute: "https://example.com" or relative: "/admin/service-accounts"). If "dialog", will display a dialog when clicked. If not specified, no link will be displayed.

linkText.description: The text to display on the link. If not specified, will be displayed as "More info".

dialogTitle.description: The title to display on the dialog. If not specified, this will be the same as `linkText`.

dialog.description: The markdown to display on the dialog. If not specified, no dialog will be displayed.
dialog.example:
# Information

Maintenance is **scheduled**.

## More details

This is an example dialog that supports Markdown.

bannerSchema.description: An object describing a banner to be displayed to all users.

id.description: The banner's ID. Banner IDs are incrementing integers. In other words, a more recently created banner will always have a higher ID than an older one.

message.description: The message to display to all users. Supports markdown.
message.example: **Reminder to everyone**: Maintenance is scheduled for *2337-12-27*.

enabled.description: Whether the banner should be displayed currently. If not specified, defaults to true.

variant.description: The variant of the banner. One of "info", "warning", "error", or "success". If not specified, defaults to "info".

sticky.description: Whether the banner should be sticky on the screen. If not specified, defaults to `false`.

icon.description: The icon to display on the banner. Can be one of https://fonts.google.com/icons. If not specified, this will be the default icon for the variant. If "none", no icon will be displayed.

link.description: The link to display on the banner. Can either be an absolute or a relative link (e.g. absolute: "https://example.com" or relative: "/admin/service-accounts"). If "dialog", will display a dialog when clicked. If not specified, no link will be displayed.

linkText.description: The text to display on the link. If not specified, will be displayed as "More info".

dialogTitle.description: The title to display on the dialog. If not specified, this will be the same as `linkText`.

dialog.description: The markdown to display on the dialog. If not specified, no dialog will be displayed.
dialog.example:
# Information

Maintenance is **scheduled**.

## More details

This is an example dialog that supports Markdown.

createdAt.description: The date and time of when the action set was created.

createdByUserId.description: The ID of the user that created this action set.

name.description: The name of the action set

description.description: The description of the action set
description.example: Disables new features when error rate is above threshold

actorId.description: The id of the service account that will execute the action

enabled.description: Whether this action set is enabled or not

actions.description: The list of actions executed in sequential order when the action set was triggered, decorated with the individual action states.

match.description: Defines a matching rule for the signal that will trigger the action set

source.description: Match the source of the signal

sourceId.description: Match the source id of the signal

payload.description: Match the payload of the signal

actionDefinitionParameterSchema.description: Defines a parameter for an action.

name.description: The name of the parameter.

type.description: The parameter type.

options.description: Lists of options to be used for the parameter.

actionDefinitionSchema.description: Configuration of a single action and its parameters.

description.description: A description for the action.
description.example: Enable a feature flag in a specific environment.

permissions.description: The permissions required to perform the action.

parameters.description: The parameters required to perform the action.

actionDefinitionsConfigSchema.description: Configuration of different actions and their parameters.

toggleFeatureActionSchema.description: Input data required for the action

project.description: The project where the feature is located

environment.description: The environment we want to target

featureName.description: The name of the feature we want to target

toggleFeaturesByTagActionSchema.description: Input data required for the action

project.description: The project where the feature is located

environment.description: The environment we want to target

tag.description: The tag we want to target, in the following format: `[TAG_TYPE]:[TAG_VALUE]`

trafficUsageApiDataSchema.description: Contains the recorded data usage for each API path, segmented by day and type of traffic

days.description: An array containing each day in the selected period that has data usage recorded

day.description: The day of the period for which the usage is recorded

trafficTypes.description: Contains the recorded data usage for each type of traffic group

apiPath.description: The path of the API that the recorded data usage is for

trafficUsageDataSegmentedSchema.description: Contains the recorded data usage for each API path, segmented by day and type of traffic

period.description: The year-month period for which the data usage is counted

apiData.description: Contains the recorded daily data usage for each API path

scimSettingsSchema.description: An object describing settings for SCIM provisioning.

enabled.description: Whether SCIM provisioning is currently enabled.

assumeControlOfExisting.description: Whether SCIM assumes control of existing users

hasToken.description: Whether a SCIM provisioning API token is currently set.

setScimSettingsSchema.description: An object describing settings for SCIM provisioning.

enabled.description: Whether SCIM provisioning is currently enabled.

assumeControlOfExisting.description: Whether SCIM assumes control of existing users

scimTokenSchema.description: An object describing a SCIM provisioning API token.

token.description: The token used for SCIM API authentication. Can be revoked at a later stage by generating a new one.

changeRequestPlaygroundRequestSchema.description: Data for the playground API to evaluate flags with change request applied in preview mode

tags.name: Addons
tags.description: Create, update, and delete [Unleash addons](https://docs.getunleash.io/addons).

tags.name: Admin UI
tags.description: Configuration for the Unleash Admin UI. These endpoints should not be relied upon and can change at any point without prior notice.

tags.name: API tokens
tags.description: Create, update, and delete [Unleash API tokens](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api-tokens-and-client-keys).

tags.name: Archive
tags.description: Revive or permanently delete [archived feature flags](https://docs.getunleash.io/advanced/archived_toggles).

tags.name: Auth
tags.description: Manage logins, passwords, etc.

tags.name: Banners
tags.description: Create, update, flag, and delete [banners](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/banners).

tags.name: Change Requests
tags.description: API for managing [change requests](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/change-requests).

tags.name: Client
tags.description: Endpoints for [Unleash server-side clients](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/sdks).

tags.name: Context
tags.description: Create, update, and delete [context fields](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/unleash-context) that Unleash is aware of.

tags.name: Dependencies
tags.description: Manage feature dependencies.

tags.name: Edge
tags.description: Endpoints related to Unleash on the Edge.

tags.name: Environments
tags.description: Create, update, delete, enable or disable [environments](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/environments) for this Unleash instance.

tags.name: Events
tags.description: Read events from this Unleash instance.

tags.name: Feature Types
tags.description: Manage [feature flag types](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/feature-toggle-types).

tags.name: Features
tags.description: Create, update, and delete [feature flags](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/feature-toggles).

tags.name: Frontend API
tags.description: API for connecting client-side (frontend) applications to Unleash.

tags.name: Import/Export
tags.description: [Import and export](https://docs.getunleash.io/how-to/how-to-environment-import-export) the state of your Unleash instance.

tags.name: Instance Admin
tags.description: Instance admin endpoints used to manage the Unleash instance itself.

tags.name: Maintenance
tags.description: Enable/disable the maintenance mode of Unleash.

tags.name: Metrics
tags.description: Register, read, or delete metrics recorded by Unleash.

tags.name: Notifications
tags.description: API for managing [notifications](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/notifications).

tags.name: Operational
tags.description: Endpoints related to the operational status of this Unleash instance.

tags.name: Personal access tokens
tags.description: Create, update, and delete [Personal access tokens](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api-tokens-and-client-keys#personal-access-tokens).

tags.name: Playground
tags.description: Evaluate an Unleash context against your feature flags.

tags.name: Projects
tags.description: Create, update, and delete [Unleash projects](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/projects).

tags.name: Public signup tokens
tags.description: Create, update, and delete [Unleash Public Signup tokens](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/public-signup-tokens).

tags.name: Search
tags.description: Search for features.

tags.name: Segments
tags.description: Create, update, delete, and manage [segments](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/segments).

tags.name: Service Accounts
tags.description: Endpoints for managing [Service Accounts](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/service-accounts), which enable programmatic access to the Unleash API.

tags.name: Strategies
tags.description: Create, update, delete, manage [custom strategies](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/custom-activation-strategies).

tags.name: Tags
tags.description: Create, update, and delete [tags and tag types](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/tags).

tags.name: Telemetry
tags.description: API for information about telemetry collection

tags.name: Unstable
tags.description: Experimental endpoints that may change or disappear at any time.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: Manage users and passwords.
